actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Roll Call 109
actions-list.actionItem: 2/3 Yea and Nay vote pending.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3250 — "To recognize the Margaret Woodbury Strong Museum in Rochester, New York."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 108).
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 107).

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1125 — "Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 7888) to reform the foreign intelligence surveillance act of 1978; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 529) to extend the customs waters of the United States, consistent with presidential proclamation 7219; providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1112) denouncing the Biden's administration's immigration policies; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1117) opposing efforts to place one-sided pressure on Israel with respect to Gaza."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 10.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1125, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Leger Fernandez demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1125.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1125 — "Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 7888) to reform the foreign intelligence surveillance act of 1978; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 529) to extend the customs waters of the United States, consistent with presidential proclamation 7219; providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1112) denouncing the Biden's administration's immigration policies; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1117) opposing efforts to place one-sided pressure on Israel with respect to Gaza."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. McGovern to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 10.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Bost to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
